New Records: Rohit Sharma scores the fastest World Cup century by an India player (off 63 balls)
Rohit Sharma becomes the leading six-hitter in international cricket
Rohit Sharma hits the most sixes in international cricket
Rohit Sharma overtakes Sachin Tendulkar with the most centuries at World Cups
New World Cup record... Rohit's 79 is the most runs scored by one player out of the first 100 scored by their team (men's and women's WCs)
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scores 131 runs off 63 balls, setting a new record for the fastest World Cup century by an India player
Kishan gets out to Rashid Khan for 47, reducing India's target
Rashid Khan takes 4 wickets for 39 runs in his spell
India wins the match by 8 wickets with 15 overs to spare
Kohli scores an effortless fifty off 44 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma says it is very important to get momentum at the start and he feels good about putting the team in a good position
Hashmatullah Shahidi says their thinking at the toss was that it was a good pitch and they wanted to put up big runs
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expresses pride in the team's resilience after a close win and remarks that winning the series was a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup
Rashid Khan takes 4 wickets for 39 runs in his spell, but it was too little, too late
Miscellaneous Highlights: Virat Kohli comes in to finish the job and sends his home crowd into raptures with an effortless fifty
Others: James Wallace now, Daniel Harris earlier
Weather or pitch conditions affecting the match (rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side)
